item.title: 'Not harsh enough': Ricky Ponting criticises Virat Kohli's fine for Sam Konstas incident - The Times of India
item.description:
'Not harsh enough': Ricky Ponting criticises Virat Kohli's fine for Sam Konstas incident

Publication Date: NEW DELHI

Source: Times of India

Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting has expressed disappointment over the 20 percent match fee fine imposed on Virat Kohli for an altercation with debutant Sam Konstas, arguing that the punishment is insufficient given the incident's visibility and context.

  • Ponting criticizes the 20 percent match fee fine for Kohli, stating it is not harsh enough.
  • The altercation involved Kohli shoulder-bumping Konstas during a match.
  • Ponting mentioned the broader implications for young players, stating it may lead to misunderstandings regarding acceptable behavior.
  • He emphasizes the responsibility of senior players to uphold standards in the sport.
“I personally do not think it [the punishment] was harsh enough... sometimes it is just different for some people.” - Ricky Ponting

In conclusion, Ponting believes that fines should reflect the role models that players like Kohli represent, urging for stricter actions to maintain the integrity of the game.

item.title: 'Sachin Tendulkar always answered with his bat': Basit Ali slams Virat Kohli after Sam Konstas altercatio - The Times of India
item.description:
'Sachin Tendulkar always answered with his bat': Basit Ali criticizes Virat Kohli after altercation with Sam Konstas

Date: Not specified Source: Times of India

Former cricketer Basit Ali has spoken out against Virat Kohli following a recent incident during the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground where Kohli collided with Australian player Sam Konstas.

  • The altercation occurred as Kohli was frustrated with Konstas’ performance.
  • Basit Ali criticized Kohli's actions, stating he seems guilty of inappropriate behavior.
  • He compared Kohli’s actions unfavorably to Sachin Tendulkar’s past conduct in similar situations.
  • The ICC fined Kohli 20% of his match fee and issued a demerit point for the incident.
  • The incident has sparked debate about discipline in cricket and the fairness of penalties for high-profile players.
“It’s really disheartening to see this controversy... Virat Kohli is guilty.”

The discussion surrounding Kohli’s actions highlights ongoing concerns about player behavior and the enforcement of disciplinary measures in professional cricket.

item.title: Chelsea's title hopes in tatters as Rodrigo Muniz makes Fulham history - 5 talking points - The Mirror
item.description:
Chelsea's title hopes in tatters as Rodrigo Muniz makes Fulham history - 5 talking points

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Mirror

The latest Premier League clash saw Fulham steal a victory at Stamford Bridge, severely denting Chelsea's title ambitions with a last-gasp goal from Rodrigo Muniz after Chelsea initially took the lead through Cole Palmer.

  • Rodrigo Muniz's late winner marked Fulham's first win at Stamford Bridge since 1979.
  • Cole Palmer opened the scoring for Chelsea with a stunning goal before Fulham equalized through Harry Wilson.
  • Fulham dominated the second half and capitalized on Chelsea's defensive mistakes.
  • This defeat leaves Chelsea four points behind league leaders Liverpool.
  • Marco Silva's Fulham demonstrated strong overall teamwork and execution of their game plan.
“Few can marry such nonchalance with devastating effectiveness.”

Chelsea's inconsistencies raise questions about their title contender status as they struggle to maintain form, suggesting that more changes might be needed to solidify their position in the league.

item.title: "IPL contract, batting like Virender Sehwag": Ravi Shastri gives special compliment to Australian Test debutant Sam Konstas - Crictoday
item.description:
IPL contract, batting like Virender Sehwag”: Ravi Shastri gives special compliment to Australian Test debutant Sam Konstas

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Crictoday

Former India player Ravi Shastri has expressed admiration for Australian Test debutant Sam Konstas after his impressive performance against India in the first Test at Melbourne. Konstas’ aggressive batting impressed, particularly against Jasprit Bumrah.

  • Sam Konstas scored 60 runs off 65 balls, hitting 6 fours and 2 sixes.
  • Ravi Shastri compared Konstas to Virender Sehwag for his fearless batting style.
  • Shastri mentioned that Konstas would likely have received an IPL contract if his performance had occurred prior to the mega auction.
“He batted fearlessly like Virender Sehwag. Viru was sensational against Australia in 2003, and Konstas had that kind of attitude and approach at the crease.” - Ravi Shastri

In conclusion, Shastri believes Sam Konstas has the potential to be a significant player in both international cricket and in the IPL, citing his fearless batting approach.

item.title: Karnataka edge past Punjab in Vijay Hazare Trophy thriller; Mumbai, Maharashtra bag wins - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Karnataka Secures Thrilling Victory Against Punjab in Vijay Hazare Trophy

Date: October 2023 Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka edged past Punjab by one wicket in a thrilling encounter, propelled by Mayank Agarwal's unbeaten 139 runs. Meanwhile, Mumbai and Maharashtra recorded decisive wins in their respective matches.

  • Mayank Agarwal scored an unbeaten 139, leading Karnataka to victory against Punjab, who were bowled out for 247.
  • Mumbai triumphed over Arunachal Pradesh by nine wickets after bowling them out for just 73 runs.
  • Maharashtra also secured a commanding win against Meghalaya, finishing with nine wickets in hand.
  • Tamil Nadu showcased a strong performance, defeating Uttar Pradesh by 114 runs, led by Shahrukh Khan's 132 not out.
“Mayank carried his bat through the innings, scoring 17 fours and three sixes.”

This thrilling match highlighted individual brilliance and team efforts, with Karnataka emerging victorious amidst strong competition.

item.title: Shubman Gill dropped for second spinner in MCG Test - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Shubman Gill Dropped for Second Spinner in MCG Test

Date: Dec 26, 2024
Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian cricket team made a surprising decision to drop Shubman Gill from the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground to include Washington Sundar as a second spinner, leading to questions about the team's batting depth.

  • Shubman Gill was not seen during team warm-ups and left the field early before the toss.
  • The team opted for a bowling attack featuring six bowlers instead of utilizing Gill's batting skills.
  • Assistant coach Abhishek Nayar explained that the decision was based on pitch conditions and the need for variation in their bowling attack.
  • Nayar acknowledged the impact of such decisions on young players like Gill, who are eager to prove themselves.
  • Gill's away record has been underwhelming, but he has been working hard in practice, indicating potential for future opportunities.
“I think a lot of the decisions when they are made and the process of it being made, the communication is always there and transparency is there.” - Abhishek Nayar

This decision raises questions about the balance between batting and bowling in the team and how it may affect future matches.

item.title: How Did Virat Kohli Escape An ICC Ban Despite 'Physical Contact' With Sam Konstas In Boxing Day Test.. - NDTV Sports
item.description:
How Did Virat Kohli Escape An ICC Ban Despite 'Physical Contact' With Sam Konstas In Boxing Day Test - Explained

Publication Date: December 26, 2024
Source: NDTV

The altercation between Virat Kohli and Sam Konstas during the Boxing Day Test sparked widespread discussion in the cricket community. Kohli received a Level 1 breach charge resulting in a 20% fine but avoided a suspension.

  • Kohli faced a physical confrontation with Konstas after the 10th over.
  • The ICC fined Kohli 20% of his match fee and issued one demerit point.
  • Experts speculated that a ban could occur, but Kohli received only a fine.
  • This demerit point is the first for Kohli since 2019.
  • ICC Article 2.12 was cited concerning inappropriate physical contact.
"Virat Kohli has been fined 20 percent of his match fee and awarded one demerit point for breaching Level 1 of the ICC Code of Conduct."

The outcome raises questions about the applicability of ICC regulations regarding player conduct and the severity of penalties for on-field incidents.

item.title: Indian startup founder who made ₹20 lakh daily recounts how he lost business to Amazon - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Once a Top Seller on Amazon: An Entrepreneur's Cautionary Tale

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The founder of a home organiser company shares his journey from making ₹20 lakh daily to losing almost everything after Amazon entered the market with private labels.

  • The entrepreneur's brand peaked with ₹20 lakh in daily revenue on Amazon and Flipkart.
  • He turned down Amazon's buyout offer, feeling unstoppable at the time.
  • Amazon's private labels, specifically Solimo, became direct competitors, drastically affecting his sales.
  • Now, he reflects on missed opportunities for generational wealth and the emotional toll of his downfall.
“The potential for creating true generational wealth was ripped out from under me.”

This entrepreneur's experience serves as a warning about the volatility of online markets and the challenges facing small businesses in the shadow of e-commerce giants like Amazon.

item.title: Former India player holds Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj responsible for Sam Konstas' aggressive fifty in the Boxing Day Test - Crictoday
item.description:
Irfan Pathan Critiques Bumrah and Siraj for Sam Konstas' Aggressive Fifty

Publication Date: December 26, 2024
Source: Crictoday

Former all-rounder Irfan Pathan criticized Jasprit Bumrah and Mohammed Siraj for their performance in the Boxing Day Test, allowing debutant Sam Konstas to score a solid fifty.

  • Sam Konstas, a 19-year-old debutant, scored 60 runs off 65 balls, including six boundaries.
  • He formed an 89-run partnership with Usman Khawaja.
  • Pathan believes the Indian bowlers failed to pitch the ball correctly, allowing Konstas to settle down.
  • Konstas was involved in a controversial moment with Virat Kohli during the match.
  • He replaced Nathan McSweeney for the last two Tests of the series.
“Sam Konstas is an LBW candidate but the Indian bowlers didn’t try to pitch the ball up and force him to drive the ball... By the time they corrected their mistake, Sam Konstas was up and running.” - Irfan Pathan

The criticism from Pathan highlights the challenges faced by the Indian bowlers in adapting to the conditions and the implications for their performance in the series.

item.title: Man City 1-1 Everton (26 Dec, 2024) Game Analysis - ESPN India
item.description:
Man City 1-1 Everton: Boxing Day Clash Analysis

Date: 26 Dec, 2024 | Source: ESPN (IN)

The match between Manchester City and Everton ended in a 1-1 draw, marking a continued slump for the City side. Bernardo Silva's early goal was equalized by Iliman Ndiaye's strike, while Erling Haaland failed to convert a penalty.

  • Bernardo Silva scored the opening goal in the 14th minute.
  • Iliman Ndiaye equalized for Everton in the 36th minute.
  • Haaland missed a penalty in the second half, impacting City's chances of winning.
  • Manchester City has won only once in their last 13 matches.
  • Everton remains five points above the relegation zone.
“England's number one,” chanted Everton supporters for their goalkeeper Jordan Pickford after the match.

This match highlights Manchester City's struggles in the league, while Everton holds on to a precarious position above the drop zone.

item.title: Dane Paterson five-for, Corbin Bosch's four rock Pakistan in Centurion - ESPNcricinfo
item.description:
Dane Paterson five-for, Corbin Bosch's four rock Pakistan in Centurion

Date: [Insert publication date] | Source: ESPNcricinfo

South Africa's bowlers, led by Dane Paterson's five wickets and Corbin Bosch's four, dismantled Pakistan during the first Test in Centurion, leaving the visitors struggling at 209 for 9 by tea.

After a shaky start, an 81-run partnership between Kamran Ghulam and Mohammad Rizwan provided a glimmer of hope for Pakistan, but South Africa's relentless bowling proved too much. The match showcased tense moments, including a notable exchange between Ghulam and Rabada.

  • Dane Paterson recorded 5 wickets for 61 runs.
  • Corbin Bosch took 4 wickets for 63 runs.
  • Kamran Ghulam scored 54 runs, showing resilience.
  • Rizwan supported Ghulam with 28 runs.
  • South Africa reduced Pakistan to 209 for 9 by tea.
“It was frustrating for Pakistan after a magnificent first hour of bowling went unrewarded.”

In conclusion, South Africa's superior bowling attack showcased their dominance and left Pakistan struggling heading into the final session of play.

item.title: Jasprit Bumrah's Celebration After Dismissing Travis Head For A 7-Ball Duck Goes Viral: Watch - News18
item.description:
Jasprit Bumrah's Celebration After Dismissing Travis Head For A 7-Ball Duck Goes Viral: Watch

Date: December 26, 2024
Source: News18

World No. 1 Test bowler Jasprit Bumrah captivated audiences as he dismissed Australia's Travis Head for a duck during the ongoing Boxing Day Test against India.

  • Bumrah bowled a stellar delivery that sent Head packing after just seven balls.
  • The incident occurred during the fourth Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground.
  • Head's dismissal marked the second wicket taken by Bumrah in the match, having previously dismissed Usman Khawaja.
  • After the wicket, Bumrah's enthusiastic celebration with teammates went viral on social media.
  • If Bumrah claims two more wickets, he will achieve the milestone of 150 wickets in the World Test Championship.
“He is on track to become the first pacer to record 10 five-wicket hauls in this World Test Championship.”

The incident highlights Bumrah's impressive form and adds excitement to the ongoing Test series.

item.title: "Chill. I'll...": Usman Khawaja To Sam Konstas After Virat Kohli Altercation In Boxing Day Test - NDTV Sports
item.description:
"Chill. I'll...": Usman Khawaja To Sam Konstas After Virat Kohli Altercation In Boxing Day Test

Publication Date: December 26, 2024 | Source: NDTV

Usman Khawaja intervened to de-escalate a confrontation between Virat Kohli and young player Sam Konstas during the Boxing Day Test in Melbourne. The situation arose after a shoulder bump between Kohli and Konstas, which led to a heated exchange of words.

  • Khawaja stepped in to separate Kohli and Konstas.
  • Kohli was fined 20% of his match fee and received one demerit point for his actions.
  • Former players criticized Kohli's behavior during the incident.
  • Australian media expressed dissatisfaction with the ICC's penalty on Kohli.
"Chill. I'll talk to him. You chill, and I'll sort this out." - Usman Khawaja

The incident generated significant media attention and discussions among former players about the conduct expected on the field.

item.title: Rohit Sharma warns Marnus Labuschagne's act in 4th Test; Sunil Gavaskar fumes at umpire for staying silent - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Rohit Sharma warns Marnus Labuschagne's act in 4th Test; Sunil Gavaskar fumes at umpire for staying silent

Date: Dec 26, 2024 Source: Hindustan Times

The Boxing Day Test at the Melbourne Cricket Ground saw a confrontation between Rohit Sharma and Marnus Labuschagne, concerning Labuschagne's running on the pitch's danger area, leading to criticism of the umpires by Sunil Gavaskar.

  • Rohit Sharma confronted Marnus Labuschagne over running on the danger area of the pitch.
  • Sunil Gavaskar voiced concerns about the umpires not acting on the rule violations.
  • Labuschagne had just scored a half-century in the 4th Test of the Border-Gavaskar Trophy.
  • The first day ended with Australia at 311/6, with Steven Smith still batting.
“That’s supposed to be the umpire’s job,” said Irfan Pathan, highlighting the umpire's lack of action.

This incident adds to the ongoing tension in the closely contested series, illustrating the competitive spirit and attention to rules among players.
